Name: Reel Them In
Description:
You are the leader of a small fishing village on the main land of the Trifecta Islands. The fishing season has just begun and the waters are splashing around with the local breeds of fish known as the three most exotic and rarest commodities in the world.

With a small crew of worker boats and your newly acquired captain ship, you must hoist your anchors and set sail so you can; cast out bait, control the fishing areas, improve your catching abilities, influence the market, expand your fleet, fulfill contracts, create profit and earn your way to the top against rival villages when you try and Reel Them In.

Reel Them In is a highly player interactive fishing game where players compete to be the best fishing village once the fishing season ends. The game brings new innovative mechanisms and Board layouts that has never been done before. Everything fits in thematically in a streamlined and moderate strategic manner. New strategies can develop each time you play and with team play variants a whole new level of competition can be discovered.

-description from designer

Name: Tiny Epic Kingdoms: Deluxe Edition
Description:
Tiny Epic Kingdoms: Deluxe Edition was available only by the Kickstarter campaign. It included inside the box the base game and Tiny Epic Kingdoms: Deluxe Promo Pack.

Note: It was not until the second edition that the exploration tiles became part of the base game. For the first deluxe edition, it was part of the deluxe content. The second deluxe edition entry is here: Tiny Epic Kingdoms: 2nd Edition â€“ Deluxe Edition

About the game:
You are a tiny kingdom with big ambition. You want to expand your population throughout the realms, learn powerful magic, build grand towers, and have your neighbors quiver at the mention of your name. The conflict? All of the other kingdoms want the same thing and there's not enough room for everyone to succeed...

In Tiny Epic Kingdoms, a 4x fantasy game in a pocket-size package, each player starts with a unique faction (which has a unique technology tree) and a small territory. Throughout the game, players collect resources, explore other territories, battle each other, research magic, and work to build a great tower to protect their realm.
Families: Players: Games with expansions that add solo play

Name: Tiny Epic Kingdoms: 2nd Edition – Deluxe Edition
Description:
Tiny Epic Kingdoms 2nd edition deluxe includes the base game and Tiny Epic Kingdoms: 2nd Edition â€“ Deluxe Promo Pack.

Tiny Epic Kingdoms 2nd Edition features these refinements taken from community feedback:

Rulebook clarifications.
Faction card clarifications.
Game component improvements.
Players may now retreat from war.
Improved 2 player variant (The Lost Kingdom)
TEK Exploration tiles now included in every copy (previously they were included in the deluxe content for 1st edition.

The first deluxe edition may be found here Tiny Epic Kingdoms: Deluxe Edition

About the game:
You are a tiny kingdom with big ambition. You want to expand your population throughout the realms, learn powerful magic, build grand towers, and have your neighbors quiver at the mention of your name. The conflict? All of the other kingdoms want the same thing and there's not enough room for everyone to succeed...

In Tiny Epic Kingdoms, a 4x fantasy game in a pocket-size package, each player starts with a unique faction (which has a unique technology tree) and a small territory. Throughout the game, players collect resources, explore other territories, battle each other, research magic, and work to build a great tower to protect their realm.
Families: Players: Games with expansions that add solo play

Name: Yarrr Har Hunt
Description:
Yarrr! It's time to find some treasurrrrrrre!

Yarrr Har Hunt is a co-operative family game for players of all ages to play together. You are a band of pirates working together to follow the clues and reveal the buried treasures hidden around Shell Island.

At the start of the game, treasure chest cards are placed face-down beside the board with a series of secret clue cards on top. The first clue for each chest is revealed and an X-marks-the-spot token placed on the board at each clue's location.

On their turn, players draw a shell from a bag to determine how many spaces they can move. If a player lands on space marked with an X token, they collect that clue card. The next clue card in the hunt is revealed and the X token moved to the new clue's location. If a player collects the last clue in a hunt, they uncover the treasure chest and reveal the treasure inside. Players can also choose to give their movement shell to another player who may be closer to a clue or treasure.

If a player draws a ship shell, the pirate ship moves one space closer to shore. When it reaches the island, it's time to go- The hunt is over and any unfound treasure is lost.

Yarrr Har Hunt is designed to allow very young players with limited game experience to play side-by-side with older kids and adults. The surest path to success is for all players to share turns and work together to divide the finding of clues and treasure. A typical game lasts 15 minutes.

—description from the designer

It’s a treasure hunt race: players help Captain Casey and her crew discover the Shell Island Treasure by uncovering clues. But be quick: the ship will soon be back to end the hunt! Players work together and problem solve to figure out where the treasure is hidden. This cooperative game has all players working together to win!


     Uncover clues together to discover the Shell Island Treasure!
     Kids learn communication, simple strategy, cooperation and shared-decision making.


—description from the publisher

Name: Berlin Manalaysay's Combatron: The Card Game Rise of Megadeath
Description:
The Battle is not yet finish. Be prepared for the bigger threat!

The stand-alone expansion to Berlin Manalaysay's Combatron: The Card Game based on the popular 90's Filipino comic strip. More Space Warriors arrives including Axel, Armorgeddon, Mechababe and Combatron in his second armor. The game still uses the same mechanics from the first Combatron Card Game and can be combined with it.
Power vs Power - Player with the highest total power wins and deals damage to opponent
Power vs Assist - No Damage will be dealt but card effects will still trigger
Assist vs Assist - Both cards will cancel out each others effect

The goal is still the same, have all your opponents take 4 damage and be the last one standing.

In addition, there is a new game mode called "Megadeath vs. Space Warriors" where 1 player takes the role of Megadeath with his arsenal and all other players with their Space Warriors vying to defeat him.

—user summary

Name: Luck Plus / O'NO 99
Description:
A combo box containing Luck Plus and O'NO 99.

The object of O'NO 99 is to avoid totaling 99 points or more, which would cause you to lose that round of play. If a player loses four rounds, they are out of the game.

The deck consists of 54 cards; three each of 2s through 9s, four Holds, six Reverses, ten 10s, four -10s, two Double Plays, and four O'NO 99s (which count only as hand-fillers); there are also 24 tokens that are used to keep track of losses - a player surrenders a token when they lose a round.

Each player starts with four cards and three tokens; on their turn, each player draws one card and then plays one from their hand, all the while the total on the table increasing until 99 is reached. The player that ends their turn on 99 points (or more) loses the round and surrenders a token; those with no tokens left are out of the game. Last player with remaining tokens wins.

Luck Plus is a unique card and dice game of number matching. The object is to be the first player to eliminate all of your cards by matching cards and dice. Each player is dealt 8 cards face up. The remaining cards are stacked face down in the center of the table to form the draw pile. The top card of the draw pile is turned face up and placed next to the draw pile to form the match pile. Each player will then try to get rid of as many cards as possible by matching the numbers on the cards with the numbers on the dice they roll. There’s a bit more to it than that, but you’ll have to see the rules to get the whole picture.

Name: Geländebrettspiel
Description:
Despite the explicit intention of the designer to invent a completely new, innovative game, it's based on chess. But considering he invented the game in the 30s of the last century, it’s an impressive and complex idea.
Before the actual playing starts, the board is assembled according to 3 dice. The 64 tiles form an 8 x 8 board showing sometimes a different landscape like wood, lakes and hills. There will be a river and a road. On each end of the road, there will be the own city of each player on his base line (the closest tiles).
Each player has 8 (+2 for the advanced version) pawns. They have different moving patterns that are restricted by the actual landscape.
Once during play, a player is entitled to a double move. The first player who conquers the city of his opponent or captures his "Stander" (like the king in chess) wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Aeronautica Imperialis: Skies of Fire
Description:
The Aeronautica Imperialis: Wings of Vengeance boxed set includes everything you need to play exciting games of aerial combat between aircraft from the Astra Militarum and the T'au Air Caste.

The set includes the following Citadel multipart plastic miniatures, each supplied with an Aeronautica Imperialis base:

3x Imperial Navy Lightning Fighters (can be assembled as Lightning Fighters or Lightning Strike Fighters)
    2x Astra Militarum Valkyrie Gunships (can be assembled as Valkyrie Gunships or Vendetta Gunships)
    2x T'au Barracuda Fighters (can be assembled as AX-5-2, AX-5-3, or AX-5-4 Fighters)
    2x T'au Tiger Shark Bombers (can be assembled as AX-1-0-2, AX-1-0-3, or AX 1-0-4 Bombers)

The set also includes a 36-page rulebook featuring the following information:

The full Aeronautica Imperialis game rules, including how to build your force using Squadron Lists, how to perform Ace Manoeuvres, field different classes of aircraft and unleash ground defences. Learn how to manoeuvre your aircraft, adjust their altitude and change speed while avoiding the risks of crashing and breaking up (if you exceed your maximum speed). There are even rules for special manoeuvres including landing, taxiing, and taking-off.
    The Dogfight scenario, as well as optional rules for fighting at night or in bad weather conditions
    Squadron Lists, providing details of all of the aircraft in the box as well as their weapon options and special rules
    A reference page showing the 8 different manoeuvres aircraft can take, as well as a 2-page quick reference containing the key game rules


    A 4-pages booklet with three starter scenarios (Ambus, Breakthrough, The Straggler)

1x double-sided card Area of Engagement game board (depicting two aerial war zones)
    1x double-sided card token sheet (70 tokens to help you keep track of all the action)
    8x Six-sided dice (white with black pips)
    1x Transfer sheet (for the Imperial Navy, Astra Militarum, and T'au aircraft included in the set)
    2x Quick reference cards (containing the key game rules)
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Zemo's Journey
Description:
Zemo's Journey is a roll-and-write game introduced in the 2020 4th Roll-and-Write competition. In this game, the player helms the Tritus and sails across a treacherous ocean to find treasure, combat fearsome monsters of the deep, and protect (or plunder!) towns that dot the seascape. With multiple maps and starting conditions, each game offers a unique adventuring experience. And to play again, simply erase the board (or print out a new one) and start sailing!

In each turn, the player rolls dice and, using a unique movement mechanic, plots a course across the map. When that course encounters a monster, island, or another ship, the player resolves a combat, discovers treasure, or perhaps repairs damage. The captain's log allows the player to track resources and encounters as well as the current level of Danger. By carefully managing damage to the ship and keeping the cannons fully stocked, the player just may survive until the end of the game.

After the final turn, the player scores victory points based on both the resolved encounters but also on the Motivation chosen at the start of the game. Each Motivation scores encounters differently and also offers a unique bonus. As an Adventurer, Protector, or Plunderer, the total score will determine whether Zemo gains the glory he quests for. Or will he end up in a forgotten watery grave?

-description from designer

Name: Monte Cassino 1944
Description:
The game covers three important battles of the Italian campaign. Allied landing near the port of Salerno, executed on 9 September 1943 under the codename “Avalanche”, was a part of the Allied invasion of Italy. The Italians withdrew from the war the day before the invasion, but the Allies landed in an area defended by the German troops that quickly started a number of counterattacks. The battle of Monte Cassino (17 January-18 May 1944) was a costly series of the four assaults by the Allies against the Winter Line. The capture of Monte Cassino resulted in 55,000 Allied casualties, with German losses estimated at around 20,000. In the battle of Ancona (16 June-18 July) Polish II Corps captured an important Italian port of Ancona. Game gives players a lot of units to command and shows all there battles in the detailed way, so players have a chance to change the course of any of these.

Monte Cassino 1944

System: Battles of the World War II (B-35)

Complexity: very high

Scale: battalion-company

Boards: 2x 50/70 cm, 1x 30/30 cm

Scenarios: 3

-description from publisher's website
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players
Series: Bitwy II wojny światowej 1943-45 (Dragon / Taktyka i Strategia)

Name: Pets and Pirates
Description:
Brace yourself for a crazy pirate treasure hunt. Be ready to meet tactical penguins, boarding chicken, cheating octopus, and much more. Through your journey, you will find new pirates ready to join your crew, powerful pets allies and unexpected events or even monsters. Pets ’n’ Pirates is a strategic card game.

Each player starts with a pirate captain and 3 adventure cards. The goal is to find the treasure card buried in the deck (or steal it from another pirate) and hold it up to the end of the game (when the last card is drawn from the deck)

Every turn a player can look for the treasure in the main deck, spy on other players, attacking them, playing tricks, or all these actions combined. At the end of each turn, the player draws a card from the deck: it could be the treasure, a powerful adventure card to keep for the next turn, or an unexpected event that must be shared with all the other pirate.

Easy peasy?
Not really! A cursed pirate is hiding in the deck waiting to take the treasure away from you.

-description from designer

Name: Platoons: Core Rules
Description:
Tactical skirmish-sized wargaming rules that can be used for multiple settings/periods.

Features:

     Strategic and tactical with many interesting choices
     Order Point system allowing units to be used multiple times per round
     Advanced Fog of War mechanics using hidden units to keep your opponent guessing where your units are and how many of them are left
     Open list creation to allow you to create and organize your force the way you wish with many possibilities
     Early and late war combined armies as well as useful special upgrades for every list allows each force to have a fighting chance against even the best equipped armies
     Dynamic scenarios with varied set-up options for a different experience each time


Army Lists

     Army lists are available for free and updated at the publisher website


—description from the publisher

Name: Ingredo Plants
Description:
A plant themed combine and collect card game with elements of Mahjong (pick up thrown cards) and UNO (card matching). As an added bonus there are 3 mode of play available from the same deck.

To win a game of INGREDO PLANTS you must be the first to plant 10 Plant cards. There are 10 unique Plant cards and 11 unique Habitat cards. There are 3 special cards: shovel, seed vault and greenhouse cards. Shovels when discarded let the player draw 3 cards. Seed vaults and greenhouses can be used as any single plant or habitat card respectively. Each Plant card requires at least 4 habitat cards in hand to plant a Plant card.

Players start with 6 cards in hand and choose to draw 1 card from a HABITAT deck or from the top of a recycle pile each turn then discard 1 card into the recycle pile.

There are 3 modes of play: GARDEN, CHASE, and WILD. In GARDEN and CHASE players draw from a HABITAT deck which only has habitat cards, plant cards are separated. In WILD mode players draw from a WILD deck with both plant and habitat cards mixed together.

GARDEN: each player is given 10 plant cards in a face down garden deck and must plant the plants cards in the given order. First to completely plant all their plants wins.
CHASE: each player competes to plant a common plant card, first to plant get the card, first to get 10 plant cards wins.
WILD: by drawing from a WILD deck each player must now have both the plant card and the required habitat cards in hand to plant. First to plant 10 cards wins.

-description from designer

Name: More Mountainous Mayhem: Crags Adventures and Classes for Four Against Darkness
Description:
More Mountainous Mayhem: Crag adventures and classes for Four Against Darkness, for characters level 4+

Here Be Mountain Adventures!
Had enough of dank dungeons? 
Or are you looking to generate the world outside of them?
Explore the mountain wilderness with this new supplement for Four Against Darkness.

Featuring new rules, floor tiles and lots of options:
• Rules for aging, firearms, mining, climbing and swimming
• Crags tables for treasure, events, locations and magic items
• New mounts, quests, milestones, reactions, retainers, expert skills
• New character classes: bear folk, chronomancer, dark elf, fish people, night elf, half-orc, moose folk, owl folk and tree folk
• Over 50 new monsters native to the mountains! Cloak monsters, wyverns, specters, weremoles, perytons, stalactite monsters, fire-throwing zeppelins, wildcats, storm giants, fire elf gypsies, cave trolls, hostile dwarves, horrid hares, dark elf dominatrixes and the undead dwarf-thralls of the Lich King!
• Six new Temporal spells
• Rules for clerics of three new deities
• Nine special narrative missions and much more!
Requires only the core Four Against Darkness book. 
Fully compatible with the woodlands exploration rules from the Crucible of Classic Critters, for expanded wilderness exploration!

Contains adult humor and mature content.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pipeline
Description:
Pipeline is a surprisingly fun 3D pipe laying game. Presented as a kid's game, gamers will enjoy it as a light contest too. 4 players have colourful plastic sets of plumbing; straights, angles, T joints and capping pieces. Start from one side of the board, spin a spinner (or roll a special die) to select your piece and try to build a pipeline over to ending points on the opposite side. You can rotate your pipeline if required, but not backtrack, so when your neighbour's pipe gets in your way, you have to build over or around. First to connect wins.

Compared to Pipeline, this has a 5x5 grid and fewer components.

Name: Shewsheep Shameless Buffet
Description:
You and your friends are at THE famous multinational buffet place. The chef cooks food from all over the world, but sends out only five dishes a time, and the chef might not cook the same food for quite some time, so if you want to eat it, you have to snatch it before everybody else. Today you have to choose between friendship and good food.

The take-that card game Shewsheep Shameless Buffet lets you compete with your friends over food. You want to be the first to reach 25 points, and eating food in a combo results in a bonus score, so grab what you need to fill the plate. Many trick cards allow you score extra points or play tricks on your friends.

The owner of Shewsheep and friends characters — Sumit Simargool — is also the co-creator of this game.

—description from the designer

Name: Dot Dot Dot
Description:
Dot Dot Dot is the adult party game of terrible texts. Complete the text message conversation with the funniest answer card and you're guaranteed to win. But let's be honest this game isn't about winning, it's about laughing and enjoying the company of your friends and family. Dot Dot Dot comes packaged in a sturdy tin box that packs easily in a purse or backpack. Play Dot Dot Dot on your next trip to the beach, camping, road trip or weekend getaway. You can play with as few as four players or as many as you can fit around a table. Dot Dot Dot is great for large groups of friends and family. It also works as an icebreaker for new friends. Dot Dot Dot makes a great gift for college, weddings, birthdays, or your really open minded grandfather's 80th birthday.

The Judge draws a conversation card and reads it aloud, afterward displaying the card for all to see. Everyone else submits an answer card face down that best completes the conversation. The Judge shuffles the answers, reads them aloud, and selects a winner.

—description from the publisher

Name: Der Wienerwald
Description:
Old and typical roll and move board game about the travelling through Vienna Woods'(Austria). The Vienna Woods was the royal hunting grounds from the 11th century until 1850.  Industrial development beginning circa 1840 encouraged increased settlement of the area. In 1870, plans were brought forward to clear most of the forest, but this caused widespread public resistance. In 1987 signed the Vienna Woods Declaration to protect nature in this region.

The first player, who cross the route first - wins the game.

—user summary

Name: 5 Alive / Uno
Description: This game primarily is a version of 5 Alive but includes the game UNO as an extra.

Name: Quad Play
Description:
4 hearts together. 4 pieces in each. 4 of all are different. 4 decades of combinations. In short everything is related to the number 4.
    Game-play is based on a special shape resulting from combining 4 hearts. The way the hearts are merged makes each divided in 4 pieces. The whole shape has 9 pieces in total instead of 16 as some are common for two or more hearts.
    A 'quad' is the shape described above with any 4 pieces ('qarts') marked in contrasting colour. According this quads can be divided in two groups (sides): light ('glim') quads if qarts are darker than other parts (as the 4 of qarts is always the minority) and dark ('grim') quads if vice versa. Each qart has value in points depending on the number of hearts it is common for. So it can be 2, 4 pts for glims, -2, -4 for grims and 0 for both. Changing qarts order gives 20 meaningfully distinctive combinations for each side, 40 quads in total. Quads in a side are rank-ordered. The overall ranking follows the qarts configuration (all qarts in one heart is the best) and is subdivided in two dimensions: vertical (4 'piles') and horisontal ('atop' 0-4 according the number of quads above). The priority between sides can be set by game rules and vary in playing progress.
    The system can provide new experience in randomising, solitaire, card and dice playing as well as refresh many traditional games.

Name: Juduku 2: La Fesse Cachée
Description:
Like the rest of the Juduku games, Juduku 2 is a party game requiring players to answer dodgy, immoral and/or trashy questions in less than 8 seconds. Spontaneity is key!

The player with the lowest IQ is declared "Juduku Master". They will have to accept or decline the answers made by the rest of the group. If they like the answer or if it is fitting, the player who made it keep the question card and score a point ; otherwise nothing happens. The first player to score 7 points wins.
This second game in the series encourage you to explore your worst thoughts. This edition comes with:

     400 new question cards
     80 special "dare" cards
     new game modes


—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Club Pétanque
Description:
The club is proud to present you the counter petanque! Fast, simple and fun, this summer it will be your perfect companion for an aperitif. In double or triplets, it's up to you! So, do you shoot or point? As with petanque, every time you throw, shoot or point, choose the right dice!

The Club Pétanque game box contains:
1 field: a mini tray in several copies
2 dice: 1 "shooter" die to attack your opponent, 1 "pointer" die to place your "balls" on the field
6 blue "balls"
6 white "balls"
1 storage bag
1 rule of the game.
Made in France.

Name: Ultracombat Modern: Skirmish Combat Rules
Description:
Bring the frantic action, the individual heroics and the weapons of modern-day combat to your tabletop with Ultracombat Modern.

These rules are an easy to play, fast-paced. A set of wargames rules for depicting the harsh realities of conflict as it occurs in modern warfare.

As a player, you can choose to play at the Platoon level, Squad level or Fireteam level. The system allows players to select the scale of the conflict they wish to represent. This means the rules work for small tactical Special Forces style games up to more substantial Platoon based combat.

Players are rewarded for using modern tactics, can call in off-table assets and field vehicles up to and including even the most effective Main Battle Tanks (MBT).

Ultracombat Modern provides players with everything they need to recreate 20th and 21st-century conventional warfare conflicts, whether real or imagined.

—description from the publisher

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Double Masters
Description:
Everything is doubled about Double Masters. Double the rare slots, double the box toppers, double the first-picks in Draft.


     332 cards
     24 packs per booster box
     15-card booster packs (with two rares and two foil cards per pack)
     Two non-foil borderless showcase box topper cards included in each booster box


—description from the publisher

Name: Tumble Town: Round Up
Description:
Tumble Town: Round Up expands Tumble Town by adding in some new building plans that will benefit your town if you've got the right scenary and a new type of card: Wild Mustangs! Tame a wild mustang and earn the respect of the Townspeople, but it's not going to be a walk in the park to do so.

-description from publisher

Name: Shaky Shark
Description:
Test your fishing skills and your reflexes against the Shaky Shark!

This hungry shark shakes and wobbles as you try to fish out the wreckage from his mouth. You'll need to most fast though, as the timer counts down and the shark will chomp down on your fishing pole!

Who will manage to get all the prizes out from Shark's mouth?

Hungry shark shakes and wobbles as you try to fish out the wreckage from his mouth. Times goes off unannounced and the shark's mouth closes on the losing player.

Components: 1 wobbling shark base, 4 fishing poles, 20 sea-themed play pieces, and instructions.

Name: Battle of the River Plate
Description:
Battle of the River Plate is a fast play introductory set of WW2 naval rules covering the famous battle of the same name, fought in December 1939 off the coast of South America.  It was the first naval battle in WW2.

It opposed, in the South Atlantic, the German heavy cruiser Admiral Graf Spee and one of the British Navy hunting groups composed of HMS Exeter, Ajax, and Achilles.

It is a fast play introductory set of rules, including ship counters (or you can use your own models).

Scale:
1"= 500 yds
1 turn= ~4min
1 hull damage point per 500 tons displacement.

Turn Sequence: 

     Initiative Phase
     Movement Phase
         Player A moves their ships
         Player B moves their ships
    
     Gunnery Phase
         Player B resolves their gunfire
         Player A resolves their gunfire
    
     Torpedo Phase
         Move any torpedo counters on the table
         Player A launches torpedoes
         Player B launches torpedoes
    
     Damage Control
         Both players roll to see if they can repair any damage
    


- User summary

Name: Boss Battle
Description:
Boss Battle is a one versus many tabletop strategy card game featuring many ruthless bosses and four distinctly designed classes of heroes who use their unique skills to duke it out in a casting board system.

The Boss dominates the board throwing out obstacles the heroes must learn to work together to overcome. As the game progresses, heroes level up, and build their deck to adapt to challenges on the casting board. Heroes must think strategically, the Boss only gets stronger as the rounds progress!

With the variety of unique heroes, and bosses with diverse playstyles, players face new challenges every round. No two games are the same. Take pleasure in crushing your friends...and enemies, in Boss Battle! Play 1-4 players in cooperative, competitive or solo gameplay modes!

—description from the publisher

Name: Reiten
Description: A simple children's roll & move game in the ZDF Sportstudio-Linie range of small box sports board games.

Name: Radfahren
Description: A simple children's roll & move game in the ZDF Sportstudio-Linie range of small box sports board games.

Name: Break Par Golf Game
Description: A simple card-driven golf game with crayons to mark where your ball lands. Each shot you choose between Driver, Fairway Shot, Approach, Trap Shot, and Putting. Flip the next card and see how far you've hit the ball and mark accordingly with the wax crayons, or your pawn. Each hole has a number of spaces between the tee and the green denoting the distances between them, with fairways marked white, approaching zones yellow, and traps red.

Name: Poker Roll
Description: A lighthearted carnival-game style poker game of rolling marbles to mark cards and score the best hand you can. Roll 5 marbles up the inclined board towards a number of poker cards with holes in them. Try to sink the best cards and use the chart at the bottom of the board to see how many points your hand is worth. A new way to play poker, where skill is just as important as luck.

Name: Elections of US America Election: The Expansion Pack
Description:
The amazing, vote-tastic expansion comes with an additional 21 cards, including 14 new Wonk cards, 5 Scandal cards and 2 cards with the special edition rules adding a whole new way to play (sort of like a campaign mode!) where you're doing the primary and the main election. More fun than an impeachment hearing!

-description from publisher's website

Name: Political Animals
Description:
The non-confrontational strategy game for financial conservatives, social liberals, financial liberals, and social conservatives alike ... in 20 minutes or less.

Politics is not a game—unless you’re a politician.

Players of Political Animals compete to pass Policies in order to advance their political Agendas. They advance their Agendas by voting strategically and anticipating how other players will vote. The player whose Agenda prevails at the end of the game is the winner.

Every round has three phases: Draw (players gain Political Capital), Policy Rollout (players determine which policies will be up for vote), and Legislative Session (players lobby for their positions, make promises they may or may not keep, and then vote on Policies). All players vote (Yea, Nay, or Abstain) for all of the Policies in the Policy Rollout at the same time and simultaneously reveal all their votes after the Presiding Officer has called "Time!" The amount of Political Capital players use when voting will affect the outcome. Each Policy vote is resolved (Pass or No pass) in turn—with the Center of Gravity token (COG) moving on the game board as the Policy dictates.

The Political Animals game board is a grid with the four quandrants and a Moderate center representing player Agendas. The COG starts the game in one of the four center locations that make up the Moderate center. The COG's location is always public and players can see every move it makes as a result of Policies being passed. The COG location represents the current prevailing Agenda.

The final location of the COG on the game board identifies the winner of the game.

Short-game and long-game variants are included along with the major Hidden Agenda variant, as well as Special Ability cards and Amendments that may be added in to change up play.

—Description from publisher

Name: Juduku 3: Le Vice Ultime
Description:
Like the rest of the Juduku games, Juduku 3 is a party game requiring players to answer dodgy, immoral and/or trashy questions in less than 8 seconds. Spontaneity is key!

The player with the lowest IQ is declared "Juduku Master". They will have to accept or decline the answers made by the rest of the group. If they like the answer or if it is fitting, the player who made it keep the question card and score a point ; otherwise nothing happens. The first player to score 7 points wins.
This second game in the series encourage you to explore your worst thoughts. This edition comes with:


     400 new question cards
     80 special "truth or dare" cards
     1 rulebook presenting different game modes


—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Ironclad and American Civil War Naval Wargames Rules
Description:
Ironclad and American Civil War Naval Wargames Rules: 
A set of miniature rules to simulate combat on the seas

Play goes in a succession of:

     Movement
     Firing + Ramming & damage resolution


It contains raw data but ships information will have to be calculated by the players.

Scales
1" = 100 feet.
1 move = 1 minute
1" = 1 knot

Name: Animal Football
Description:
The most exciting football tournament is about to begin! Join us in the challenge: choose five players from a row of dozens of characters with unique qualities and attractive designs to enhance your playing style. Get ready to face your friends in this fantastic game that combines tactics and actions.

Move your players on the rectangle field, make the most of each player's characteristics like speed, pass, shot, dribbling, contrast and interception. Create fast or intricate actions to bring your team to score more goals than the opponent in the regular 45 minutes, or prepare to face the penalties, where in the event of a tie, you will have to challenge your opponent in a match of intuition and luck until you win the game.

The game is based on a few of intuitive mechanics. With the qualities of the characters well highlighted on the card, which indicates the dice to be thrown to perform the action that has been set up: in this way, your fun is guaranteed from the first minutes of the game. Meanwhile, the large space left to the player's creativity allows to develop an infinite number of tactics - with a great depth of game, able to satisfy even the most experienced players. What are you waiting for?

-description from designer

Name: Senso: Japanese Feudal Warfare Rules for Skirmish Actions
Description:
A set of miniatures rules for tabletop skirmish actions in Feudal Japan.  These skirmish level rules are written to cover the period 1200 AD to 1500 AD. This period begins with the ascendancy of the Daimyo and ends in the "Age of War."

The rules are intended to cover skirmish type actions which might involve thirty figures per side. The game can be played with either 15mm or 25mm sized figures. The measurements given are for 25mm figures and should be halved for 15mm figures.

Two forces consisting of samurai, ninja, mercenaries, and peasants, face off over variable scenarios.  Features a point-buy system for force creation.

Turn structure is fairly fluid -- figures act in dexterity order, performing their action (fire missile weapon, or move and possibly attack).  Damage taken by a figure reduces both hit points and dexterity.

Includes a simple campaign system.

Name: Honorowy Obywatel
Description:
The Honorowy Obywatel (Honorary Citizen) game describes the preparations before Marshal Józef PiÅ‚sudski's visit to BiaÅ‚ystok. The Chief of State will arrive in the morning of August 21, 1921 and, before receiving the title of Honorary Citizen of BiaÅ‚ystok, will take part in numerous ceremonies. The players try to organize all planned events at the best possible level.

The game is played with cards, most of which represent the time of day (morning, midday, or evening) or the place (Main Railway Station, KoÅ›ciuszko Square, Branicki Palace, or the Barracks at Traugutta Street). The organization of each event consists of collecting a set of cards that correspond to its place and time of day: the player who collects the appropriate set gains glory points. Players who haven't had time to help organize the event can also earn Glory Points as long as they collect cards that allow them to participate. The game will be won by the player who has the most glory points at the end - and thus will be the most remembered in the history of BiaÅ‚ystok.

-description from designer

Name: Arcadia Quest: Usagi Yojimbo
Description: Wandering the world on a musha shugyõ (warrior’s pilgrimage) has brought Miyamoto Usagi across many bizarre situations, but none so strange as the dangers regularly encountered in the fabled city of Arcadia! Fortunately, Usagi has been reunited once again with his companions Gen the rhino bounty hunter, and Kitsune the vixen thief. Between them, there’s nowhere Arcadia’s villains can hide! In Arcadia Quest, each player controls a Guild with three unique Heroes. These Guilds compete against each other and against the monstrous forces on an epic campaign to rescue the city of Arcadia. But only one Guild may lead in the end!

Name: Zbuduj miasto: Planszówka z Sulejówka
Description:
The game shows the expansion of Sulejówek in the first half of the 20th century.

Players place tiles representing roads and buildings on the table, creating three historical layers. Correct placement of a tile on the lowest layer is awarded with victory points, while on the second layer it allows the player to make an additional move. The highest-scored tiles, depicting interesting monuments of the town, are placed on the top layer. When laying the tiles, players often have to decide whether they want to make additional moves, while making it easier for their opponents to place tiles on the top layer.

In the full game, the winner is the player with the most victory points at the end. In the simplified version, the winner is the one who gets rid of either his roads or monument tiles.

-description from designer

Name: Aquaman
Description:
Aquaman is a one-vs-many card game featuring the prominent characters of the Aquaman 2018 movie.

Each turn, the villain player must lay a given number of cards face down in a row and the heroes players must lay the same number of cards so that each individual hero card faces a villain card.

Cards are then revealed one by one, and damage is dealt according to a rock-paper-scissors mechanism. If one side is out of health points by the end of the turn, the game ends and the other side wins, otherwise a new turn begins. Ties are won by the heroes.

Name: Jam Session
Description:
The curtain opens for a new Jam Session, enjoy a quick game with your family and friends.

Become a musician and show everyone that you are the best, improvise without fail and thus you will be the leader of the band.

Choose your character, shuffle the deck and deal the cards corresponding to each player.

In each turn you will have to play a card that you must combine with the active card on the table to achieve a score of 7. Only then will you be able to advance in your point board, but don't worry, if you cannot do it with your cards you have the opportunity to do it using the improvisation die. Do not trust your score, during the game events that can change everything appear.

The player who first completes his board wins.

Do not detune if you want to be the best in Jam Session.
publisher's summary

Not to be confused with ã‚¸ãƒ£ãƒ ã‚»ãƒƒã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ (JAM SESSION).

Name: Shattered Lance
Description:
Shattered Lance is a deck-building game with worker placement elements based on medieval jousting tournaments. Knights face-off against each other over the course of a seven day tournament with each round consisting of a Court Phase and Joust Phase. At the end of the seven days, the knight with the most victory points is named King's Champion.

Knights participate in one-on-one matches and gain reputation and gold for their victories. Between matches they visit the Court to gain new items or mounts, gain favors from nobles such as the King and Queen, mingle with nobles to increase their reputation, or gain additional training for their knight and squires.

During the Court Phase players place their knights and squires within the Royal Court. Squires spend gold to purchase items for their knights while the knights use their reputation to gain them. Players can build their decks at the "Training Grounds" to be used in the Joust phase.

During the Joust Phase players will compete against their opponent using their decks. Items gained or purchased in the Court Phase can be used during the joust to aid the knights. There are four passes within each joust. During a pass each player strategically plays three different cards from their hand consisting of the "Herald", the "Shield", and the "Levee". Knights start with 10 stamina which they spend to play cards from their hand and lose it when they are hit by their opponent's "Levee". If a knight's stamina reaches 0, they are unhorsed and can decide to remount if they still have a chance at victory. The first knight to score 10 points by the end of the fourth pass gains a victory token, gold, and reputation.

At the end of the seventh day, players combine their victory point total based on their cards, victory tokens, and reputation points. The player with the most points wins the tournament!

-description from publisher

Name: The Sherlock Files: Vol II – Curious Capers
Description:
Are you a modern mastermind detective?

The Sherlock Files: Curious Capers includes three new confounding cases for you to solve. First, you will investigate the family, friends, and business partners of a freshly deceased don. Next, you will uncover how a group of devious jewel thieves and their loot vanished into thin air. Finally, you will discover the truth behind a disastrous laboratory fire.

Decipher clues to determine which are relevant to the case and which are not. Share what you deem relevant with your detective partners. Which theories will you chase?

How will you fare compared to the world’s greatest detective? Work together to solve each case and find out!

Name: The Sherlock Files: Vol III – Puzzling Plots
Description:
Are you a modern mastermind detective?

The Sherlock Files: Puzzling Plots includes three new confounding cases for you to solve. First, you will track down a man who vanished during his shift at the cemetery. Next, you will pursue the truth of what happened to a fabulously rich butler. Finally, you will hunt down the man behind the wheel of a suspicious hit-and-run.

Decipher clues to determine which are relevant to the case and which are not. Share what you deem relevant with your detective partners. Which theories will you chase?

How will you fare compared to the world’s greatest detective? Work together to solve each case and find out!

Name: Survive: Escape from Atlantis!
Description:
This 2010 edition is more than a reprint of the original Survive from 1982.

It combines the original rules to play Survive! Plus additional pieces and the rules to play Waddington's Escape from Atlantis.

This edition also came with Survive: Escape from Atlantis! â€“ Dolphins & Dive Dice Mini Expansion which were removed from the 30th Anniversary edition that came out 2 years later.

That expansion was later made available separately in 2013 for owners of the Anniversary edition.

Name: Teotihuacan: City of Gods – Increased Workforce
Description:
This module adds "Common" workers which can be moved and used by any player. Additionally, this module adds support for up to 5 players.

The Increased Workforce module was originally planned to be included in an official expansion to Teotihuacan: City of Gods. Though designed and fully developed, and occasionally teased in various threads on BGG, the decision was eventually made not to include this module as part of any printed expansion, but instead to release it for free as a print-and-play expansion for the game.

—description from publisher

Name: Scarlet Envelope I: Newspaper – Introduction to Mysteries
Description:
Scarlet Envelope is a series of Canadian-made mail-in games with an escape room feel. Chapter One includes 13 games (envelopes) full of engaging brainteasers with web & video integrations.

"Newspaper: Introduction to Mysteries" is the first game in the 13 series that gets you familiar with codebreaking and gives you teasers of the storyline-based games ahead of you.

All thirteen can be played separately and in any order but there is one overarching element in the whole series (in each game you search for one hidden letter to collect a password to something in the thirteenth game.)

"Did you know that a Secret Society has been watching you? Now, you’ve been selected for a test. You will receive a Scarlet Envelope full of mysterious items that seem to be from the different worlds...and times. Make sense of all the items and prove yourself worthy of joining this obscure secret society."

“Newspaper: Introduction to Mysteries” envelope includes:
One Cryptic Newspaper
One map
Two posters
Two vintage letters
A mysterious ticket
Videos, audio, and web pages
More than 13 puzzles to solve
Instructions and Online Hints

Name: Warships of the Russo Turkish War
Description:
Warships of the Russo Turkish War, 1877-78
are ship stats for over 70 Ottoman and 60 Russian ships, from ocean going ironclads and frigates to converted commercial steamers, gunboats, riverine craft and torpedo boats.

Information is presented for LFG’s Broadside and Ram and Dahlgren and Columbiad, and also for A&A Game Engineering’s Iron and Fire.

Also included are campaign specific gunnery tables for Iron and Fire

—description from the publisher

Name: Player of the Game Golf
Description:
A quick play card and dice golf simulation, which enables a whole tournament to be played in a couple of hours.
Golfers are rated in various skill and scoring categories.
Course have variable difficulty levels.
Each golfer completes a round based on the result of 1, 2 or 3 die rolls.
Base game includes generic golfers and courses.
Additional seasons can be bought featuring actual golfers and courses.
Available in printed and pdf formats.

Name: Fingabol
Description:
In turn, the players shoot to score in the opposing goal. Calculate your trajectories, bounds off the frame in an exhilarating one-on-one where every rebound counts.

Game starts form the middle of the central circle

Turn by turn, players shoot the puck once to score in the opposite side

A point is scored when the puck touches the goal area

When the puck goes out of field, the opponent puts it back in play on his penalty area line

The first player to score 5 points wins the game.

Name: Trains on a Train
Description:
This is a game that needs no table. So you could play it on a train, in a plane or even in the back seat of the family car on a road trip.

Players hold a hand of tiles as though playing cards, but have a score bag hanging on a loop from their wrist.

On a turn, a player will draw a random tile from a draw bag (the railway yard) that gets passed around after each turn. The draw bag holds rolling stock (locomotives and wagons) and loads.

Then the player discards a tile from their hand. That tile may go into their own score bag or back to the yard to get them an action.

What players are trying to do with the score bag is create a loaded train, pulled by the correct locomotive type, worth the most points when the game ends.

-description from designer

Name: Targeto
Description:
In Targeto, players try to hit pawns for cups with your catapult. Preparation of each gameplay depends on the variant they choose players among 5 different fun proposition contained in the manual.

Among the variants we find:
Remembering the chips
Earning points
Making sounds
pets and collecting chips
Telling a fairy tale
Line arrangement
pawns fired

Name: OMNIA
Description:
Leonardo's life, travel and works. In cards.

OMNIA is an opportunity to dive into the magical Italian Renaissance, seen through the eyes of one of the greatest geniuses of all times.

In the first phase of the match, create your deck according to the strategy you think is best. Challenge the other players to collect more works and inventions by Leonardo, getting help from the famous characters of the time. Always keep an eye on the places of the journey! To collect points you must reach the objectives activated in the match.

The game develops in 6 rounds. During each round each player will have to play an Action card (the seventh card will not be played).

Each Action card provides for a maximum of two sequential actions, indicated by their respective symbols.

Possible actions are: activate a City card picking it from the deck; take a Work, Invention or Character card among the ones on the table; take coins from the bank.

Perform the actions provided for by the action card.

—description from the designer

Name: Szalone Gary
Description:
Guess what's hiding in your pot!
Before the game fill the pots different opponent delicacies.
It depends on you, what the other players will have to try.
Will it be sour lemon or a piece chocolate? Or maybe something else?

Escape with your pots outside the board, close your eyes, open up
pot and try the contents! If you can guess, you get a point!

Who will guess all your flavors first, wins the game!

Name: Myśl Kolorem Junior
Description:
How about a crazy game of colors starring? In this unusual game your task will be to give a quiz answer questions using 11 cards
colors.

In the Junior version, the questions rotate around children's interests and world - heroes of fairy tales, toys, flavors
childhood and familiar surroundings.

Name: Classic 3 Game Naval Set
Description:
This Classic 3 Naval Game Set includes three older Minden titles in a set.  
The games are Monitor vs Merrimack: Battle of Hampton Roads, 1862 (American Civil War), Great War Salvo!: Solitaire Tactical World War I Naval Game (World War I solitaire), and Emden vs. Sydney (World War I).

Monitor vs Merrimack recreates the Battle of Hampton Roads, March 1862, between the Union Monitor and the Confederate Merrimack (Virginia), the first battle between ironclad warships.  Comes with 12-page rule booklet, set of ship counters, standard rules and game tables covering the famous battle initial battle of March 9, and optional rules and March 8 scenario.  Originally published in 2012. For two players, low complexity.

Great War Salvo! Promo ed.. is an introductory but fully functional and playable solitaire WWI naval game using the Great War Salvo! system. (If you own GWS! 2nd or 3rd ed. no need to buy this, as you already have everything in this edition).  Four pages of rules and tables, two counter sheets (Sheet A and B, 48 rated warships of various types and nationalities).  This fairly low complexity, solo game edition was originally published in 2014.

Emden vs. Sydney is a two-player World War I game, using a modified Fletcher Pratt game system to smulate the Battle of Cocos, November 1914, between the German Emden and the Australian Sydney.  Comes with eight page rule booklet with rules and tables, sheet of ship counters, six ship data cards.  Moderate complecity. Originally published in 2015.

Name: Tiny Epic Mechs: Man vs. Meeple Promo Cards
Description:
Promo pilot cards, originally available through Man vs. Meeple's 2020 Kickstarter campaign.

Featuring: 
DrakkenStrike: "OVERLOAD: After you damage an opponent with a weapon, you may immediately discard that weapon from the game to double its damage.

Wayfinder: "PULSE VACUUM: When you take damage from a mine or turret, immediate collect one energy and one credit."

OffDutyNinja: "REMOTE DRONE: When you take a Deploy Mine/Turret action, you may instead move any 1 of your mine or turrets up to 2 adjacent spaces into an empty space for free.

Name: Dungeonology: Unruly Students
Description:
There is an air of rebellion in Rocca Civetta! The aspiring professors got tired of the rules of the University and accompanied by their brotherhoods, they will enter the dungeons causing chaos.

With this expansion, the Scholars of the core game become fearsome Boss. Each of them will be at the head of a new university brotherhood with specific Students, of different colors, who will act against the players in the most disparate ways.

When one of these new Boss is used in the game, the Students of its brotherhood can be used in addition to the standard Students of the core game, and drawing one of them from the University Bag will activate the boss special powers!

Finally, in this expansion, you will find rules for playing games with two of these Bosses in the same game; double threat, double fun!

--description from the publisher

Name: Dungeonology: Triple Threat
Description:
With this expansion, a new Mega Boss comes into play! The chaotic Spriggan of the woods will stick to the Scholars, annoying them in completely new ways!

Spriggy in Boots, with his giant boots, will make noise by calling attention to the Student he chooses to follow, but he can also guide him to the most inaccessible places of the Dungeon.

Pinky, with his devastating punches, will chase away all the Students who approach his Scholars, but at the same time threaten the opposing Scholars.

The Brain, with his huge and bulky mask, constantly distracts his Scholar, even if he will help him collect Information Cubes.

But the real treat will be revealed when the three Spriggans meet, joining together to form the terrible SPRIGGAZORD! This Spriggan totem will annoy all Scholars, teleporting to their areas and continuing to follow them relentlessly!

--description from the publisher

Name: Zeal
Description:
Zeal is a game of religious conquest in a 16th century type of setting. Each player represents a different religion/cult that is trying to spread across the globe.

Gameplay is simple but strategy is deep and luck is not a factor. Players, on their turns, can take one action (move pieces, produce more pieces, convert an area to their religion, or slaughter pieces).

Each player also has 4 miracle cards that they can use to their advantage (each god has its own unique set of 6 miracle cards to choose from).

Game can end in 2 ways:
If a player places 10 temple cubes/controls 10 areas on the board (8 in a 3p game), that player wins immediately.

If every area on the board has a temple on it, the game ends immediately. The player with the most temples on the board wins. If a 3 player game ends this way and 2 players are tied for most temples, remove the losing's players temples and the 2 players that were tied for first continue to play until one of them places 10 temples.

-description from designer

Name: The Option Game Board
Description:
The Option Game Board has four levels of play, each bringing you the fun and excitement of trading for high stakes in the fastest action game in town!

Players spin the wheel to determine Buy-Sell-Expiration months, premiums and stock last sales. Option trading cards record transactions. Consequence cards create various market conditions.

Players can do transactions based on the values of the wheel trying to make as much profit as possible.

There are four rounds of trading (January/April/July/October) and the player with the most money from all their trades is declared the winner.

—user summary

Name: This Is Not a Test: The Big Book of Scenarios – Vol.1
Description:
The Big Book of Scenarios is packed with 20 scenarios written by some of the best fans in the world. Created as part of the This Is Not a Test (TNT) Scenario Community Challenge, these scenarios in this book were deemed the best of the best and are now ready to challenge your warbands.

Featured scenarios include:
Rad Roach Roundup (First Place Winner) – Charged with rounding up a settlement’s food supply, players have their warbands wrangle ornery rad roaches into their enclosures. This is easier said than done as warbands have to be cautious as combat can overexcite the roaches.

The Preacher (Second Place Winner) – This scenario is a treasure hunt with a rad zombie twist. Warbands must survive the irradiated undead to loot the corpse of a fallen preacher. Rumors say there is a powerful relic stashed away with the dead clergyman’s holy book.

     Wasteland Bases (Third Place Co-Winner) – Not one, but five separate scenarios where your warband must find a base, build it up, and defend it; all the while attacking enemy bases. With plenty of options for customization and rules for resource gathering, this fun campaign brings a near real-time strategy game feel to the TNT wasteland.


The TNT Tribal Campaign (Third Place Co-Winner) – This thematic campaign is a clever set of five warband specific scenarios featuring wasteland tribals, either played with a tribal warband or featuring the tribals as recurring foils for the warbands. In this campaign your warband delves deep into tribal culture by appeasing the wasteland spirits through sacred rights, protecting refugees during a forced migration, and even stopping ritual sacrifices.

Eight Other Exciting Scenarios – Great for one-off gaming or easily inserted into an ongoing campaign, these scenarios contain assorted of fun wasteland activities like battling deranged cultists, raiding a underground vault, stalking through bat-haunted ruins, and much, much more!

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: This Is Not a Test

Name: Battlelund: The Paper Wargame – Core Rulebook
Description:
Battlelund is The Paper Wargame. 
It is accessible, adorable, and affordable. 
Battlelund is the charm and cute that everyone needs. It is made for everybody in the world to enjoy with anybody they want. Awaken your dreamer and find the treasure that is Battlelund.

Ready to smile? Good! 
Battlelund is an exciting, fast-paced 15mm high fantasy wargame with a decidedly cute and whimsical nature. 
If the wackier, cheerier side of things appeals to you, as well as games involving strategy and choice, Battlelund has you covered! 
The game, by intention, is easy to learn and enjoy, but to be the true "bashy smashy master", well that's another story... So then, what's inside this adorable 85-page tome of wargaming goodness for all?


     Visuals: Full color! Tons of photos and cheery art detailing the Battlelund World, as well as the weaving scope of our Battlelund printable miniatures line!
     Setting: Fairy tale-styled impressions of the Battlelund World, Albrathia, with flavorful, fun quotes and snippets. 
     Rules: All the rules, spells, special abilities, game types, etc. Written in a fun, and very learnable way!
     Stats: Every unit, hero, engine, and creature of every army has their profile listed inside! All you need is right here!
     Battle Report: Not only an enjoyable read, but a fun demonstration in motion!
     Resources: Tutorials on assembly of miniatures and base covers, as well as storage and the like! Also, reference document for ease of play.


Simply put, Battlelund is fun and cheer for everyone, perfect for both children and adults. Hear the trumpets blaring? That's the Battlelund World calling. See you in Albrathia!

—description from the publisher

Name: Trézors
Description:
Trézors is a luck based card game for 2-4 players. Each player starts with an identical hand of cards, playing through them over the course of the game. A row of treasures is revealed and all players play a card out of their hand simultaneously claiming a type of treasure. If only one player claims a type of treasure in the row, they win that treasure. If more than one player claim the same treasure the first to tap it with their finger wins it. Unclaimed treasures are discarded.

The game is over when there are no more "chest” cards. The players count the number of stars present on the cards won (with rarer treasures being worth more points) and, if needed, subtract a point per "hook" card drawn. The one with the most value points wins the game.

Contents: 59 cards

Name: Escape Room: The Game – Another Dimension
Description:
Strange things have been happening in Lockholm since a research station opened on the edge of town.  When your friend who works at the station does not show up at the weekly bar night, you start to worry.  He's never missed a bar night before!

You and your friends decide to break into the research station and investigate the disappearance.  After stumbling upon proof of strange experiments you're beginning to fear that your friend might not be found in this dimension.
Families: Series: Escape Room – The Game (Identity Games International B.V.)

Name: The WitchBorn: Enter Perdition with The Pit
Description:
Enter a Dark Fantasy where Perdition is overrun by demonic WitchBorn returned from the dead. WitchBorn tear their brothers and sisters apart with an insatiable blood lust. You number among a few roaming bands of survivors—maybe all that is left of your kind!

Build your own war clan of eight survivors to recover lost cargo in WitchBorn infested plains.

Then, sell your treasures in Asylum. A derelict cathedral known as “The Pit” was converted into a tavern and bazaar. Humans, Guild, Dwarves, Elves, and Orcs bustle with the air of a dark carnival since there are no WitchBorn here. And a Guild warrior named Blood Messiah fills tankards at the world’s last standing bar. Carouse, undertake quests, and brawl. No night in The Pit is ever the same.

Play continuing adventures competitively, cooperatively, or in solo play.

Enter Perdition is a story-driven miniatures skirmish. Use the supplied standup figures, your own miniatures, or expansion sets including Reaper Bones minis. The ever-changing stories are told by free web apps so no GM is needed. The Pit accessories include The Pit adventure book, 5 sheets of templates and pop-up figures, stands for the figures, and instructions on how to get the free app for The Pit.

Play with one to six war clans and battle to take your world back from The WitchBorn.

Name: This That & Everything: People
Description: This That & Everything: People card pack is the name-dropping party game that challenges players to describe people for their teammates. A random list of six items makes winning a challenge - so be ready to shout out this, that, and everything in between to earn the most points! This card game includes exclusive content not included in the big box game and it can be played on its own or as a supplementary pack.

Name: Tricon
Description:
Tricon is a pure connection game for 3 players (one and only one player will connect and therefore win).

The game is played on a triangular board with 21 dots each of three different colors, one color for each player. These dots are laid laid out to form a triangular grid play area, which has one dot of each color for each triangle play location. There is a black dot (6 total) in each corner and the middle of each side of the triangular board, which identify non-playable locations. When the game starts, 4 dots of the same color (two sets for each color) are already connected as a three link line along the outside edges of the triangle game board. The goal is to create a path in your color that connects your two initial lines on two different sides of the triangle game board.

Players take turns connecting two dots of their color. Each turn the active player chooses an empty triangle play area. Then, they draw a line from the point of their color through the opposing side of the chosen triangle. If the next triangle is not empty there is only one possibility to leave it. The player's line continues in that direction and may go through several non-empty triangles. As soon as the line comes to an empty triangle play area it ends on the opposing point, which is the active player's color. Note: A move that would go through a triangle containing a black dot is forbidden.

A player wins if they connect their two initially filled in lines along two sides of the triangle game board.

Name: Escape Room: The Game – Wild West Express
Description:
Your smooth ride on the Wild West Express ends abruptly as the train is attacked by bandits.  You try to fight them off, but to no avail.  While they drag you off to the prison wagon, you hear their leader call out: "Okay boys!  Take all you can and get off before this train crashes into the ravine!"

As you slip out of your cell and walk past the sleeping bandit, you spot a combination lock on the door of the wagon. Maybe escaping won’t be so easy after all.
Families: Series: Escape Room – The Game (Identity Games International B.V.)

Name: Escape Room: The Game – The Break In
Description:
Tomorrow is the big opening of the new exhibition of famous artist Flora Galow, featuring her newest masterpiece.  The public hasn't laid eyes on the masterpiece yet and if it's up to you and your crew, they never will. If all goes well, the public will be admiring a forgery tomorrow.

You look around and see some documents and two empty cups on the director’s desk. It seems like the director had tea with someone. At the other side of the room is a door with a fingerprint scanner...
Families: Series: Escape Room – The Game (Identity Games International B.V.)

Name: Fantasy Realms: The Cursed Hoard
Description:
Fantasy Realms is an acclaimed card game from designer Bruce Glassco that takes seconds to learn: Draw a card from the deck or discard area, discard a card, and try to build the strongest hand by using the best card combos.

Fantasy Realms: The Cursed Hoard expands on the original, adding two new modular expansions that can be added together or separately.

Cursed Items adds a new deck of cards. Players each take one item that they can use whenever they wish to create a powerful effect, like taking double turns, hiding discarded cards, or even skipping your discard phase to keep an extra card! But whenever you use a Cursed Item, it turns into negative points at the end of the game—the more powerful the effect, the more points you lose!

Add three new suits to the game: Develop your realms with Buildings, attract powerful mythical Outsiders, and raise the Undead.

Includes 47 cards.

Name: ElevatorUp
Description:
ElevatorUp is the brand NEW kid-created, kid-designed, kid-marketed, and kid-shipped (yes, they're all me) card game! Elevator Up will keep you smiling through Ups, Downs, and even getting Stuck!

ElevatorUp is fast-paced, easy-to-learn, and never gets old. Uno, GoFish, and other classic card games begin to become monotonous. Luckily, ElevatorUp provides a much needed innovation.

It is perfect for Travel, Camp, Sleepovers, Parties, Game-Nights, and any other occasion for a card game.

THEME:
An elevator going Up, Down, and sometimes Stuck in a building!

HOW TO PLAY:
Object - Be the first one out of cards.

Setup - Give each player 3 cards face down on the table (no one is allowed to look at these), 2 cards face up on the table (everyone can see these), and 3 cards for their hand (only that player can look at those).

Gameplay -  There are three sections of the game: Beginning: Hand Cards, Middle: Face Up Cards, End: Face Down Cards.
When it is your turn, you must discard a card that is either an equal/higher floor than the previously played card or a special card. If there is no previously played card, then you can play any card. Continue taking turns and discarding cards until someone does not have a special card or an equal/higher floor, meaning they must pick up the entire discard pile and add it to their hand. Players must keep at least 3 cards in their hand at all times, replenishing from the remainder of the deck. The special cards, including New Building, Stuck, Penthouse, Door Closed, and Down to the Lobby, throw exciting twists and turns.
Once the deck has been completely used up and players finish playing the cards in their hand, they move onto the face up cards, leaving them for all to see. The rules are the same for this section, but their hand can be seen by other players. Once they've gotten rid of their face up cards, it is time to play their face down cards. When it is their turn, the player will flip a card onto the discard pile. If it is an equal/higher floor or a special card, then shout "YAY" or any other celebratory exclamation. If it does not, then put on your game face and pick up the entire discard pile, adding it to your hand. The first player out of cards WINS!

description from publisher

Name: Murano: Complete Edition
Description:
The Complete Edition contains Murano, Murano: Promo Cards and Murano: The Christmas Tree packaged inside the box.

About the game:

Murano the game is set in Murano, a small group of seven islands near Venice that's well-known by tourists for its glassmaking. As in Venice, the islands of Murano are separated by canals, so gondolas and transportation are at the heart of this game.

The game board depicts the islands of Murano, with the islands being divided up into building sites and walkways. Surrounding the islands is a series of action spaces, with gondolas being present in some number of them at the start of play. On a turn, you move one of the gondolas in the direction of play to an empty space, then take the action shown there. You can't pass another gondola while moving or land in an occupied space, but for a coin you can move a gondola that's in front of the gondola you want to move, and you can pay to move multiple gondolas, if needed.

Some actions place shops on the islands, with shops coming in different types. You mark a shop to show ownership, and when tourists show up later, they will shop at various stores depending on their proximity and the goods they offer. You also need to take actions to move your personal gondolas to islands so that you can take actions there.

Why are you doing all of this activity? To score victory point cards in hand, and actions on the board will let you gain additional VP cards to give you direction to your actions or let you profit from what you've already done.

You can also use some of the buildings to create glassworks, and those glassworks come into play on the VP cards, through tourist sales, and via an action space shown at the bottom of the game board image that lets you sell different types of glass for money.

Name: How Game Are You? Original Edition
Description:
This 'ORIGINAL EDITION' is named so because its the first of the Question card format games, following the previous 'COUPLES INTIMACY EDITION' board game.

In this ORIGINAL EDITION, questions are ranked A, B or C depending on whether you want a quick lite game (A's) or deeper questions (C's) or play A,B,C in order.

Player one asks the selected question of the other player(s), and they answer with the total Truth, or a total Lie. Player one has to guess is it Truth or a Lie and gains a point if they identified it correctly. This can also be played as a drinking game where the wrong guess means you take a drink. Suitable for 2-8 players 16+y/o for normal games and older if its a drinking game.

The game can also be played co-cooperatively, where all questions are Truth and take turns to ask the other(s). Lose a point for no answer given or you want to skip. Alternatively focus more on the answers and interesting conversations normally ensue for clarification or shared experiences together.

Name: D100 Dungeon: Mapping Game – Add-On
Description:
With the release of new products for D100 Dungeon, it has become important to update the mapping game with new tokens. This add-on provides these tokens, and also new rules for the additional material for D100 Dungeon that can be used with the mapping game.

Included are tokens for D100 Dungeon – The Dragon Armour – Adventure Book One, and D100 Dungeon – The Lost Tome of Extraordinary Rules, and more. You will also need the D100 Dungeon rule book and the Mapping Game in order to use this expansion.

Name: Marvel Dice Masters: Infinity Gauntlet
Description:
Dice Masters brings Collectible Dice Building to the tabletop with this award-winning competitive game set in the Marvel universe! Dice Masters is a global hit from WizKids. It uses the same proprietary Dice Building Game platform designed by Mike Elliott and Eric M. Lang. Each Countertop Display Contains 8 Draft Packs. Draft Packs contain cards and dice that can be added to your collection as normal but are ALSO optimized for draft! Whether you're drafting a team of heroes that normally appear together in comics, or you're focusing on your favorite type of energy, there will be TONS of ways to draft this set! With more than 35 heroes and villains, this set is perfect for veteran players or beginners! Teams will make their Dice Masters debut like the Infinity Watch and The Black Order. They'll be sure to shake up the game! Players will be more eager to collect this set than the Infinity Gems! Speaking of which, some of your favorite Marvel superheroes will appear in this set with abilities themed after their time spent in possession of the Infinity Gems! Whether its Captain Marvel, Black Widow, or Doctor Strange these heroes will play as you've never seen them before! This is also the biggest Dice Masters set ever, with over 150 different cards (and their dice!) to collect!

—description from the publisher

Name: Deutschland: Das Quiz!
Description:
There are 300 interesting quiz questions through the topics of pop culture, politics, science, sports, geography, everyday life and history of Germany.
Prove that you are a real Germany-expert!

This is how it's played: 
Answer the questions and get points for the right answer. 
The less help you need for the right answer, the more points you can get. When you get points you may move your character on the scoreboard. Whoever reaches the goal first, wins.

Name: Detective: Signature Series – Petty Officers
Description:
Petty Officers, written by Mike Selinker, Liz Spain and Skylar Woodies, is the second case in the Detective: Signature Series.

The call comes into Antares Headquarters: There's been a mauling. A tiger has attacked his circus handler, but something doesn't feel quite right. Could the tiger be innocent of this terrifying crime?

There's only one way to find out: You will need to investigate. But you'll need help. This time you're not going on the case alone. This time, you're taking your pets.

Detective: Petty Officers is a wild case with five new animal assistants to complement your detectives' skills. The truth is just a sniff away.
Families: Game: Detective – A Modern Crime Board Game (Portal Games)

Name: Highway 375
Description:
Highway 375 is a competitive car racing game for 2-6 players. Take on the role of vintage Hot Rod enthusiasts in a race around the infamous Area 51 in Nevada, along the stretch of road known as The Extraterrestrial Highway. The game features hand management, movement cards and checkpoints along with a challenge stage in the form of a drag racing strip. Players must balance their inventory of Food, Fuel and Money as they travel the circuit and compete for the prize. Featuring licensed brands such as STP, Moroso and Crane Cams, with a vintage styling to give the game a classic feel.

—description from the designer

Name: The TimeKeeper
Description:
The TimeKeeper is a hand management card based game for 2-5 players, featuring a unique two-piece rotational board. Players collect crystal cards of different values to power their TimeKeeper device. Wisdom scrolls can be used as variable player powers to alter gameplay. Time Keys are used to move the TimeKeeper device forward or backwards in time, altering the relationship of the crystal cards values to the board. The game ends when the first person completes their device, but the winner is the player with the highest value cards for each of the different crystal types.

-description from designer

Name: Second Great War at Sea: Tropical Storm
Description:
Second Great War at Sea: Tropic of Capricorn told the story of a war that never happened: a naval conflict between Argentina, Chile and Brazil breaking out in 1940 as part of the world-wide Second Great War. Tropical Storm picks up the story, as a German squadron arrives to aid the Brazilians and the naval war continues.

The Second Great War is our alternative-history setting, in which American President Woodrow Wilson’s attempt to mediate an end to the fighting succeeds, leaving the great empires intact to fight again a generation later. War spreads around the globe, eventually engulfing the empires’ South American allies.

Like all the other Second Great War at Sea games and books, Tropical Storm uses the rules from Second World War at Sea and is fully compatible with that series’ historical games.

Tropical Storm includes a map (covering Argentina’s central coast) and 80 new die-cut, silky smooth playing pieces (60 “long” ship pieces and 20 standard-sized square ones). Thirty new scenarios move the story along, and put even more hot battleship action on your gaming table.

Tropical Storm is not a complete game. You’ll need a copy of Tropic of Capricorn (and only Tropic of Capricorn) to play its scenarios.
Families: Series: Second World War at Sea (Avalanche Press)

Name: Black Stories: Nightmare on Christmas
Description: How could that have happened? Black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. Only yes/no answers are allowed. A spooky card game just right for any party. This version of the black stories includes 50 cards with riddles about deadly Christmas.

Name: Roll-A-Bong
Description: Roll-A-Bong is a track board game where players roll dice to move along the path. Each square has a direction to be followed by the player. The player may choose to give away the prize to another player or spectator. Landing on a Roll-a Bong square lets players roll both dice on a special results table for even more fun. The first player to reach Home wins. (from game box)

Name: Black Stories Junior: Rätselhafte Weihnachten
Description:
The successful mystery series "Black Stories" is also available in the "scary-free" version - for families with children from 8 years old. Instead of dark and scary it gets colorful and funny at the "Black Stories Junior".

"Black stories junior: Rätselhafte Weihnachten" is a very special advent calendar. There are 24 riddles to shorten the time until Christmas. The players try to reconstruct the winter secrets by asking, guessing and fiddling about.

Name: Shaka Shredders
Description:
Shaka Shredders: Rivals is a 2-player craftable card game made of interchangeable magnetized components. The game set comes as two separate decks, each representing a tribe.
